p:
W.J. Wood Plunder Store A OGDEN CITY JUL 16 1886 UTAH Fourth Street OGDEN, UTAH J. Kennedy Stout Atty. Law Spokane Wash. Terr Falls
W.J. Wood Plunder Store, B Fourth Street OGDEN, UTAH Ogden Utah July 16, 1886 J. Kennedy Stout Atty. Law Spokane Falls W. Terr Dosier I am informed that a lady by name of Mrs. Josie Wood Alias Ray Raymond has trial for murder in your city, & that you defendant there. I have known her for 15 years & known her parents she is crazy & a woman of unsound mind I was married to her in Arwood File, some 14 years ago & I lived with her for 5 or 6 years & have two boys by her although she is now dire for me & has been her dome 6 or 7 years. She would not shoot any one in her right mind she hereby crazy. I am no friend of hers and do care if should murders but I do and I really believe her to be out of her mind. I am not foreman of the grand jury of the 1st district court of Was Terr in Session in Ogden and I will sware she is and can be proven as a woman of no second reason. Please excuse this I am in a great hurry yours truly W.J. Wood Foreman Grand Jury Ogden Utah
